description: install via command line options above. takes maybe 20 minutes to boot up while it installs wine - has apolostolic fathers, free kjv, takes forever to update application from inside of Logos(it is drinking wine no doubt). but should be working ok once this update is finished. have basic functionality while it is updating.

I love that consider lunch the app on ubuntu, I love it!

But, the is not working :/

I currently installed and I opened but, it didnt work.
I supose this is a test.
Team, continuos working on this app!

I have purchased tons of Logos resources over the years, and have been forced to access them through Windows in a virtualbox when on desktop. When I discovered that someone had figured out how to use Wine to compile a snap package, I got very excited. Alas, after running the installation process, I typed "snap run logos10-unofficial" - and the program crashed before launching. The at the end of the cli readout it says "Can't attach process 0120: error 5."

I really, really hope the bugs are ironed out so that Logos Bible can be used on Linux. For now, even though it won't launch, I'll give it two stars for effort. If it ever launches, I will immediately increase my rating.
summary: Hoping for This App to be Successful

description: The app is great, but the installation on Ubunutu is still a bit sketchy. On 14 year old box it installs OK, but lags/stops on updating the app or downloading additional books. On newer Ubuntu box it starts but does not load for a login on the app account. Obviously, I will be attending to some of the tech options on my end and will update when required. Thanks to the dev for working on this project!
Cela ne fonctionne pas chez moi...
